meanings.definition: Constantly harassing or urging someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her nagging voice reminded him to finish his homework.
meanings.sent2: The nagging feeling of hunger made her grab a snack.
meanings.sent3: The nagging alarm clock refused to let him sleep in.
meanings.sent4: The nagging raindrops tapped on the window all night.
meanings.sent5: The nagging mosquito buzzed around her head, driving her crazy.

meanings.sent1: His nagging complaints about the food annoyed everyone at the table.
meanings.sent2: The nagging customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent3: The nagging cat meowed until it got its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The nagging sound of the dripping faucet echoed in the empty house.
meanings.sent5: Her nagging doubts about the plan made her hesitate.
